definition: to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome

variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

person narrow-minded and shortsighted
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object

if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)

to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
a scholarly and inquisitive individual (idiom)

to bide one's time, waiting for an opportunity to stage a comeback in public life (idiom)
to bear one's own responsibilities and not pass them to others (idiom)
to win without a fight (idiom)
